title: Apply for a nitrate vulnerable zone (NVZ) derogation online

details.overview: Register with the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) to apply for a grassland derogation to spread more than 170kg of livestock nitrogen manure per hectare
details.more_information:
This tool uses [Government Gateway](/government-gateway "Government Gateway"). 

You must apply for a derogation each year.

##Telephone and postal applications
Call the Environment Agency's Derogation Line to:

+ apply by telephone
+ get a paper application form 

$C
**Environment Agency Derogation Line**   
0845 603 3113
$C

##Getting help
Contact the Defra Helpline if you have any queries about nitrate vulnerable zone regulations and the rules about derogations.

$C
**Defra Helpline**  
<onlinehelp@defra.gsi.gov.uk>   
08459 33 55 77   
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm  

$C

##Eligibility
To be eligible, at least 80% of your farm must be grassland. If the derogation is approved you'll have to comply with additional requirements.

^You can also apply by telephone or get a paper application form by calling the Environment Agency's Derogation Line on 0845 603 3113.^


##Scotland and Wales

If you're in Scotland, you can [apply for the derogation through the Scottish Government website.](http://www.scotland.gov.uk/Topics/farmingrural/Agriculture/Environment/NVZintro/NVZDerogation201012App "apply through the Scottish Government website"){:rel="external"}

If you're in Wales, you can [find out more about the derogation](http://www.environment-agency.gov.uk/netregs/businesses/agriculture/118732.aspx "find out more information about the derogation"){:rel="external"} through the Netregs website or apply by calling the NVZ Wales helpline. 

$C 
**NVZ Wales helpline**  
01824 704060
$C

##Agents
Sign up as an [agent](https://secure.services.defra.gov.uk/wps/portal/wfa/!ut/p/c5/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os3gzdx8LQyd_A0t3X3dHA08fM1fvAEdXY3cTI6B8JE55A3dDSnQbmBHQHQ5yLX7b8cmDzAfJG-AAjgb6fh75uan6BbmhEQaZAekAekimGQ!!/dl3/d3/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/ "Sign up as an agent for Defra farm surveys and assessments"){:rel="external"} if you want to apply for a derogation for more than one farmer.

##Cross compliance
These standards are part of [cross compliance.](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/UIMenu/814240C66F10CAC8802570C7004248D4?Opendocument "Cross compliance (Rural Payments Agency)"){:rel="external"} You must meet them to get your farming subsidy under the [Single Payment Scheme](/single-payment-scheme-online "Manage your Single Payment Scheme online"). 



*[NVZ]: Nitrate Vulnerable Zone
*[CPH]: County Parish Holding number
details.introduction: To spread more than 170 kilograms of nitrogen from manure from grazing livestock on your farm, you must apply for a 'derogation'. If your application is approved and you meet certain conditions, you'll be able to spread up to 250 kilograms of nitrogen per hectare per year.
